snippet: Applicants to a new program must prove that they entered the country as children and that they have lived here since 2007, among other requirements; many cannot.
abstract: Illegal immigrants applying for program offering a reprieve from deportation are struggling to collect evidence of their activities and whereabouts from their largely undocumented lives; applicants must demonstrate that they entered the United States as children and have been in the country since 2007, among other requirements, posing a challenge to those who have lived under the radar.
lead_paragraph: Applicants to a new program must prove that they entered the country as children and that they have lived here since 2007, among other requirements; many cannot.

headline.seo: For Illegal Immigrants Seeking a Reprieve, Lack of Documents Is Again a Hurdle
headline.main: Undocumented Life Is a Hurdle as Immigrants Seek a Reprieve
headline.print_headline: Undocumented Life Is a Hurdle As Immigrants Seek a Reprieve
